IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SUPPORT EDUCATION PROGRAMS WHICH ARE HELPING TO DEVELOP THE TALENT OF THE FUTURE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE DELOITTE FOUNDATION, FOUNDED IN 1928, IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHICH SUPPORTS EDUCATION IN THE US THROUGH A VARIETY OF INITIATIVES THAT HELP DEVELOP THE TALENT OF THE FUTURE AND THEIR INFLUENCERS AND PROMOTE EXCELLENCE IN TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND CURRICULUM INNOVATION, AND HELP DEVELOP THE TALENT OF THE FUTURE. THE FOUNDATION ALSO PROVIDES DIRECT FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO MANY UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES.
IRS990.Desc: MATCHING GIFTS PROGRAM - THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS HIGHER EDUCATION THROUGH CONTRIBUTIONS TO COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES ACROSS THE UNITED STATES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM - THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS PHD EDUCATION TO HELP ALLEVIATE THE SHORTAGE OF PHD ACCOUNTING FACULTY IN THE UNITED STATES BY INCREASING THE PIPELINE OF QUALITY DOCTORAL CANDIDATES IN ACCOUNTING.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT - THE ORGANIZATION CONTINUES TO EVOLVE ALONGSIDE EDUCATION, HELPING TO SUPPORT FACULTY AND DEVELOP FUTURE LEADERS IN THE CRITICAL FIELDS OF ACCOUNTING, ADVISORY, AND CONSULTING. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS, SEMINARS, AND COMPETITIONS FOR FACULTY AND STUDENTS TO PROMOTE EXCELLENCE IN TEACHING AND LEARNING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNDER GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, A TAX POSITION IS RECOGNIZED AS A BENEFIT ONLY IF IT IS "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THAT THE TAX POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED IN A TAX EXAMINATION, WITH A TAX EXAMINATION BEING PRESUMED TO OCCUR. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED ON EXAMINATION. FOR TAX POSITIONS NOT MEETING THE "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" TEST, NO TAX BENEFIT IS RECORDED. THE FOUNDATION HAD NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS OF JUNE 02, 2018 AND JUNE 03, 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ONGOING COMMUNICATIONS WITH THE GRANT RECIPIENTS TO ENSURE THE GRANTS ARE EXPENDED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE.
SCHEDULE I IS PRESENTED ON CASH BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BASED ON AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE AND ACCOUNTING STAFF. THE FINAL DRAFT OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO ALL MEMEBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REGULARLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. EACH OFFICER, DIRECTOR, AND KEY EMPLOYEE IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT WHEN THEY JOIN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER. THE BOARD AUTHORIZES AND OVERSEES PERIODIC REVIEWS OF THE POLICIES AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROCEDURES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION WILL MAKE THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
